articles.author: Hilary Beaumont
articles.title: Canada draws on lessons from SARS to address novel coronavirus
articles.description: More than 16 years after SARS killed 44 people in Canada, health professionals say they are better trained and prepared.
articles.content:
Toronto, Canada - The novel coronavirus reached Canada earlier this month, with two presumptive positive cases in Toronto and one in British Columbia as of Wednesday afternoon.
All the patients had recently returned from Wuhan, China, where the virus origina… [+7882 chars]

articles.author: Scott Heidler
articles.title: Al Jazeera attempts to visit China's coronavirus epicentre
articles.description: Network's team travelled to region north of Hubei province, but with threat of quarantine, they were forced to leave.
articles.content:
An Al Jazeera team travelled to the Chinese region just north of Hubei province, where the virus originated.
But with the threat of quarantine, they were forced to leave.
Al Jazeera's Scott Heidler reports from Changyuan.

articles.author: Wayne Hay
articles.title: Hundreds of foreigners evacuated from China coronavirus epicentre
articles.description: Many from Japan and United States return home after evacuating from Hubei Province.
articles.content:
Hundreds of people from Japan and the United States are returning home after being evacuated from China's Hubei province.
The region is at the centre of the coronavirus outbreak which has so far left more than 130 people dead, and nearly 6,000 others infecte… [+180 chars]

articles.author: Shawn Yuan
articles.title: 'Utter chaos': Coronavirus exposes China healthcare weaknesses
articles.description: With more people infected with the coronavirus than had been with SARS, China's healthcare system is feeling the strain.
articles.content: Chengdu, China - On January 20, Fubin's father started coughing and running a fever. As residents of Wuhan, they knew about a deadly new coronavirus that had originated in the central Chinese city weeks ago, but decided to stay home and hope the symptoms woul… [+7004 chars]

articles.title: What is the economic impact of China's coronavirus outbreak?
articles.description: New cases of the flu-like virus are being confirmed every day and the death toll is rising.

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: UAE confirms first cases of new coronavirus
articles.description: The country's health ministry says it diagnosed the virus in a family from China.
articles.content:
The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has confirmed the first cases in the Middle East of the new deadly coronavirus, saying that doctors were treating a family that had recently come from a city at the centre of the outbreak.
The UAE's Ministry of Health said on W… [+1160 chars]

articles.author: Violet Law
articles.title: Looking to stars, Hong Kong fortune tellers see only clouds
articles.description: Year of the Rat expected to bring more gloom to a territory, which has been rocked by months of protests.
articles.content:
Hong Kong, China - In uncertain times, people in Hong Kong found comfort in tradition, as they rang in the Year of the Rat with certain rituals.
During the four-day holiday weekend many headed to the temples, where under the watch of deities, worshippers and… [+4057 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: China battles coronavirus outbreak: All the latest updates
articles.description: Japan, US begin evacuating citizens from hardest-hit city of Wuhan as death toll continues to rise.
articles.content:
The death toll in China from a deadly new coronavirus rose to 132 with new cases reaching nearly 6,000, state media reported on Wednesday as Japan and the United States began evacuating their citizens from Wuhan, the city at the centre of the outbreak.
